looking into it atm.

Actually - appears to work exactly the same way in the old london2012 account. Which is: the blog contributor edit screen only shows fields that have already got values! Not sure if it was always like this or a bug introduced at some point. Anyway, we can fix, but not that quickly - it's a bit tricky.

Please help - I need to create a new author with a pic...can't work out
how. I know I've done it before, and will continue my attempts while I
wait for your reply, but would be good if you could get back to me. I'm
due to be putting a blog up from a new person this afternoon and would
really love for it to be right first time...

 

________________________________

I'm working on this, but I doubt the fix will ship today. There is this (rather awful!) workaround:
1. Create the author page in the usual way
2. Edit it through Blogs > Authors. 
3. The URL will be something like http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/blog/authors/blog/contributors/12321312312.php
4. Change the "blog/authors" part of that URL to "pages/edit"
5. Voila! You're in the page editor. You should now be able to edit that picture like any other.
6. Once you're done, republish the author page. Might have to also republish their posts - not sure.

I actually created the new blogger (ruth mackenzie), then went through
the folder tab to contributors and could see the fields there. Hoping it
worked! (haven't actually had the blog through to try it, unfortunately)

 

________________________________

This turns out to have a rather obscure cause. It looks as if you use Renderer to serialize a fake page that inherits from a master template, none of the containers in the child template are included in the serialization. 
The code is in dialogs/create-blogger.jsp 

Must admit, on reflection I'm somewhat puzzled that this ever worked - there's nothing to explicitly say "serialize empty fragments", after all. But nevertheless - if you compare results (on dev) between london2012 and new2012, you'll see that on new2012 only fields from the master template are rendered (I've put some temporary debug in data-form.xsl which dumps out the input doc to make this clearer - do a view source to see it).

I could fix this by completely recoding the jsp - eg. using template.applyTransform(). Actually, that would probably be a good idea. But I'm concerned that this discrepancy between master/non-master templates could cause other problems, so I thought I'd throw it your way first to get your opinion.
